meanings.definition: A person or thing that opposes or resists pressure.
meanings.sent1: The antipress in the group always stands up against any form of pressure.
meanings.sent2: The antipress in the debate team never gives in to peer pressure.
meanings.sent3: The antipress teddy bear refused to be squished by the other toys.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an antipress, pushing back against any external force.
meanings.sent5: The antipress shield protected the knight from the enemy's attacks.

meanings.sent1: She tried to antipress the temptation to eat the entire cake.
meanings.sent2: He always antipresses stress by taking deep breaths and relaxing.
meanings.sent3: The superhero antipressed the villain's attempt to control his mind.
meanings.sent4: The tree roots antipressed the heavy weight of the boulder above them.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's mental strength helped him antipress the doubts in his mind.

meanings.sent1: The antipress material of the jacket kept the cold wind out.
meanings.sent2: Her antipress attitude towards criticism helped her stay confident.
meanings.sent3: The antipress rubber band refused to snap under the weight of the books.
meanings.sent4: His antipress beliefs clashed with the mainstream opinions.
meanings.sent5: The antipress brakes on the car prevented it from sliding on the icy road.
